content: bonbon beret is worked in two strands of yarn held together from the bottom up in a stockinette stitch the first part of the beret is worked on a 40 cm 16 circular needle while the top of the beret is worked on a circular needle using the magic loop technique a beret has a fitted double band to keep it on the head while the sides of it are a bit wider it can be worn with the slouchy part off the back off or to one side it has a classic and feminine fit is very easy to knit and is perfect for sunny spring days **size ** one size - for head circumference 56 - 58 cm \ 22 - 23 \ **measurements ** * height 20 cm \ 7 8 \ \ stem excl \ * diameter 26 cm \ 10 \ **gauge ** 22 sts x 32 row = 10 x 10 cm \ 4 x 4 \ in stockinette knitted in the round after blocking on 4 mm \ us 6\ needles for more precise result swatch in the round on the same needles you will use for the beret **needles ** 3 5 mm \ us 4\ \ 2 pairs\ and 4 mm \ us 6\ or size to get pattern gauge / \ 40 cm \ 16 \ and 80 - 100 cm \ 32 - 40 \ \ length circular needles **yarn ** 25 g or 212 m \ 232 yds\ of lace yarn and 50 g or 235 m \ 257 yds\ of light fingering yarn held together sample was knit out of tynn silk mohair sandnes garn \ 57% mohair 28% silk and 15% wool 25 g / 212 m \ 232 yds\ \ and sunday sandnes garn \ 100% merino wool 50 g / 235 m \ 257 yds\ \ held together **notions ** 10 stitch markers + 1 unique stitch marker for bor tapestry needle scissors ruler / tape measure elastic thread \ optional\ in case you are not familiar with some of the techniques additional videos will help you to understand the instructions - click here 1 check other berets on instagram - #bonbonberet 2 1 https //youtube com/playlist list=plnxknmrmtdcpjussejtxkwlrgdou65dvn 2 https //www instagram com/explore/tags/bonbonberet/
